abusefilter-edit-builder-vars-global-use:
Global edit count of the user. Abuse filter syntax option in a dropdown from the group {{msg-mw|Abusefilter-edit-builder-group-vars}}.

See also:
* {{msg-mw|Abusefilter-edit-builder-vars-user-editcount}}.

Global groups that the user is in. Abuse filter syntax option in a dropdown from the group {{msg-mw|Abusefilter-edit-builder-group-vars}}.

See also:
* {{msg-mw|Abusefilter-edit-builder-vars-user-groups}}.
centralauth-abortlogin-renamed:
Error message shown when the user's account was renamed, and they need to login with their new name

* $1 is the new username they should use.
centralauth-account-exists-reset:
Used as error message.

Parameters:
* $1 - global user's name
centralauth-admin-already-unmerged:
Parameters:
* $1 - display name for the wiki
centralauth-admin-blocked2:
Used in [[Special:CentralAuth]] to show block status. Parameters:
* $1 - (Unused) the date/time of expiry
* $2 - the date of expiry
* $3 - the time of expiry
See also:
* {{msg-mw|Centralauth-admin-blocked-indef2}}
centralauth-admin-blocked2-indef: Text to display if a user is blocked for an indefinite period on a wiki on [[Special:CentralAuth]].
centralauth-admin-blocklog: Tooltip in list of local accounts on [{{canonicalurl:m:Special:CentralAuth|target=Siebrand}} Global user manager] special page.
centralauth-admin-delete-button: Submit button. See [[:File:CentralAuth admin.png]] for a screenshot.
centralauth-admin-delete-confirm: Confirmation text asking whether the global account should really be deleted
centralauth-admin-delete-description: Description text on Special:CentralAuth. See [[:File:CentralAuth admin.png]] for a screenshot.
centralauth-admin-delete-nonexistent:
Used as error message. Parameters:
* $1 - global account's name
centralauth-admin-delete-success:
Used as success message in Special:CentralAuth. Parameters:
* $1 - username
centralauth-admin-delete-title: Used as a fieldset legend. See [[:File:CentralAuth admin.png]].
centralauth-admin-group-temporary:
Displayed to indicate that the user belongs to this group for a limited period of time.

Parameters:
* $1 - internal group name
centralauth-admin-hidden-list:
Means that some deleted content or other information has been hidden from public lists by someone having the power of 'Oversight'.

See [[m:Oversight|meta]] for explanation of 'oversight' or 'revision delete' function.

Used on [{{canonicalurl:m:Special:CentralAuth|target=Siebrand}} Global user manager special page] as one of the possible entries after the colon in {{msg-mw|Centralauth-admin-info-hidden}}.
centralauth-admin-hidden-oversight:
Means that some deleted content or other information has been hidden by someone having the power of 'Oversight'.

See [[m:Oversight|meta]] for explanation of 'oversight' or 'revision delete' function.

Used on [{{canonicalurl:m:Special:CentralAuth|target=Siebrand}} Global user manager special page] as one of the possible entries after the colon in {{msg-mw|Centralauth-admin-info-hidden}}.
{{Identical|Oversighted}}
centralauth-admin-info-attached: Label of information shown in box of 'Global user info' on [{{canonicalurl:m:Special:CentralAuth|target=Siebrand}} Global user manager] special page.
centralauth-admin-info-editcount: Label of information shown in box of 'Global user info' on [{{canonicalurl:m:Special:CentralAuth|target=Siebrand}} Global user manager] special page.
centralauth-admin-info-groups:
Label of information shown in box of 'Global user info' on [{{canonicalurl:m:Special:CentralAuth|target=Siebrand}} Global user manager] special page.

A comma separated list will follow the message.

Parameters:
* $1 - the number of groups the user is in
centralauth-admin-info-groups-manage: Link text shown in box of 'Global user info' on [{{canonicalurl:m:Special:CentralAuth|target=Majavah}} Global user manager] special page, after listing the users groups. The link is only shown to users who can edit the users global group membership and will lead to a page where the user can do that.
centralauth-admin-info-header: Header of box of information about a global user account. Used on [{{canonicalurl:m:Special:CentralAuth|target=Siebrand}} Global user manager] special page.
centralauth-admin-info-registered:
Label of information shown in box of 'Global user info' on [{{canonicalurl:m:Special:CentralAuth|target=Siebrand}} Global user manager] special page.

The following message appears after the colon: date_time (time_span)
centralauth-admin-info-unattached: Label of information shown in box of 'Global user info' on [{{canonicalurl:m:Special:CentralAuth|target=Siebrand}} Global user manager] special page.
centralauth-admin-info-username:
Label of information shown in box of 'Global user info' on [{{canonicalurl:m:Special:CentralAuth|target=Siebrand}} Global user manager] special page.
{{Identical|Username}}
centralauth-admin-intro: Introduction to [[m:Special:CentralAuth|Global User Manager]] special page.
centralauth-admin-list-blocked:
Column header on list of local accounts on [{{canonicalurl:m:Special:CentralAuth|target=Siebrand}} Global user manager] special page.
{{Identical|Blocked}}
centralauth-admin-list-editcount: Column header on list of local accounts on [{{canonicalurl:m:Special:CentralAuth|target=Siebrand}} Global user manager] special page.
centralauth-admin-list-groups:
Column header on list of local accounts on [{{canonicalurl:m:Special:CentralAuth|target=Siebrand}} Global user manager] special page.
{{Identical|Group}}
centralauth-admin-list-legend-ro: Header on [{{canonicalurl:m:Special:CentralAuth|target=Siebrand}} Global user manager] special page.
centralauth-admin-list-localwiki:
Column header on list of local accounts on [{{canonicalurl:m:Special:CentralAuth|target=Siebrand}} Global user manager] special page.
{{Identical|Local wiki}}
centralauth-admin-list-method: Column header on list of local accounts on [{{canonicalurl:m:Special:CentralAuth|target=Siebrand}} Global user manager] special page.
centralauth-admin-multi-bot:
Label shown next to the bot checkbox on [[Special:MultiLock]].
{{Identical|Recent changes}}
centralauth-admin-multi-botcheck:
Explanation of the bot checkbox on [[Special:MultiLock]].

Refers to {{msg-mw|Recentchanges}}.
centralauth-admin-multi-notfound: Error message when search returned no results
centralauth-admin-multi-username: Instructions for text box where admin will enter usernames, one per line
centralauth-admin-nonexistent:
Used as error message in [[Special:CentralAuth]] and [[Special:MultiLock]]. Parameters:
* $1 - username
centralauth-admin-not-authorized: Error message when the user doesn't have permission
centralauth-admin-rename-in-progress:
Shown on [[Special:CentralAuth]] when the account is currently being renamed. Parameters:
* $1 - global account's name
centralauth-admin-setstatus-success: Used as success message in [[Special:CentralAuth]] and [[Special:MultiLock]].
centralauth-admin-status: This message is used as label of fieldset.
centralauth-admin-status-nonexistent:
Unused error message. Parameters:
* $1 - global account's name
centralauth-admin-status-submit: Used as label for Submit button in [[Special:CentralAuth]] and [[Special:MultiLock]].
centralauth-admin-too-many-edits:
Error message when the user account being hidden has more global edits than a certain threshold.

Parameters:
* $1 - username
* $2 - number of edits
centralauth-admin-unattached:
Used cell contents on [[Special:CentralAuth]] when a user is listed that is not attached to a global user. [https://meta.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?title=Special%3ACentralAuth&target=siebrand&uselang=en example]
{{Identical|Unattached accounts}}
centralauth-admin-unhide-nonexistent:
Used as error message. Parameters:
* $1 - global account's name
centralauth-admin-unmerge: Used as label for Submit button.
centralauth-admin-unmerge-success:
Used as success message. Parameters:
* $1 - the number of unmerged accounts (formatted)
* $2 - (Unused) the number of unmerged accounts (raw)
centralauth-admin-username:
Input box label on [[m:Special:CentralAuth|Global User Manager]] special page.

{{Identical|Username}}
centralauth-admin-yes:
Used in box of 'Global user info' on [{{canonicalurl:m:Special:CentralAuth|target=Siebrand}} Global user manager] special page. Can appear after {{msg-mw|Centralauth-admin-info-locked}}
{{Identical|Yes}}
centralauth-block-editing-page:
Link text to link user to the local block list when there are pages. Parameters: 
* $1 - Number of pages.
centralauth-block-editing-ns:
Link text to link user to the local block list when there are namespaces. Parameters: 
* $1 - Number of namespaces.
centralauth-centralautologin-alreadylogg: Error message shown when [[Special:CentralAutoLogin]] is called on the local wiki while the user is already logged in.
centralauth-centralautologin-badparams: Error message when the required authentication parameters are missing or invalid
centralauth-centralautologin-badstate:
Error message shown when an invalid state is given for [[Special:CentralAutoLogin]].
* $1 - Name of the state
centralauth-centralautologin-badstate-ce:
Error message shown when [[Special:CentralAutoLogin]] is called on the central wiki with a state intended for use on the local wiki.
* $1 - Name of the state
centralauth-centralautologin-badstate-lo:
Error message shown when [[Special:CentralAutoLogin]] is called on the local wiki with a state intended for use on the central wiki.
* $1 - Name of the state
centralauth-centralautologin-badwiki:
Error message shown when an unacceptable wiki ID is given to [[Special:CentralAutoLogin]].
* $1 - The wiki ID
centralauth-centralautologin-corsfail:
Error message shown when the CORS origin check fails.

CORS (Cross-Origin Resource Sharing) http://www.w3.org/TR/cors/
centralauth-centralautologin-desc: This is the text shown on [[Special:CentralAutoLogin]] when this page is requested by a user, not by the automatic global login system.
centralauth-centralautologin-logged-in:
Message displayed by JavaScript when the auto-login succeeds. Parameters:
* $1 - username
* $2 - (Optional) user gender code, for GENDER support
See also:
* {{msg-mw|Centralauth-centralautologin-logged-in-nouser}}
centralauth-centralautologin-lostsession: Error message when the session data is lost or overwritten
centralauth-centralautologin-notposted: Error message shown when [[Special:CentralAutoLogin]] is called in form mode with an HTTP method other than POST
centralauth-complete: Title of special page "MergeAccount" when a user account is unified.
centralauth-contribs-locked:
This is displayed on [[Special:Contributions]] for locked accounts when we cannot display the log entry. Parameters:
* $1 - the username
centralauth-contribs-locked-log:
This is displayed on [[Special:Contributions]] for locked accounts. Parameters:
* $1 - the username
See also:
{{msg-mw|Sp-contributions-blocked-notice}}
centralauth-createlocal-reason: Form input asking for a reason on [[Special:CreateLocalAccount]]
centralauth-createlocal-username: Form input asking for a global account name on [[Special:CreateLocalAccount]]
centralauth-delete-empty-account: Used as the reason by the deleteEmptyAccounts.php maintenance script when deleting an account with no attached local accounts.
centralauth-disabled-dryrun: Message displayed while account unification is disabled.
centralauth-editgroup-delete-removemembe: Error message when deleting a global group with members in it.
centralauth-editgroup-display: This is a label for a localised group name.
centralauth-editgroup-display-edit:
"edit" is link text.

Parameters:
* $1 - group name
* $2 - group name (localized) e.g. {{msg-mw|group-editor}}, {{msg-mw|group-sysop}}
centralauth-editgroup-editsets: Preceded by the wiki set selector.
centralauth-editgroup-fieldset:
Used as fieldset label. Parameters:
* $1 - group name
centralauth-editgroup-invalid-name: Error shown in case the name given for the global group is invalid
centralauth-editgroup-invalid-name-lower: Error shown in case the name given for the global group is not all lowercase
centralauth-editgroup-member: Used as label for the group name or for {{msg-mw|centralauth-editgroup-member-edit}}.
centralauth-editgroup-member-edit:
"edit" is link text.

Parameters:
* $1 - group name
* $2 - group member name (localized) e.g. {{msg-mw|group-editor-member}}, {{msg-mw|group-sysop-member}}
centralauth-editgroup-name: Used as label for "Global group name" input box.
centralauth-editgroup-nonexistent:
Error shown when a global group does not exist (i.e., has no rights assigned).

Parameters:
* $1 - group name
centralauth-editgroup-noset:
Used as an option in the wiki set selector.
{{Identical|None}}
centralauth-editgroup-nowikiset: Shown on [[Special:GlobalGroupPermissions]] for global groups which have no assigned WikiSet.
centralauth-editgroup-perms: Used as label for the checkbox group.
centralauth-editgroup-rename-taken:
Shown in case the renaming of the global group failed because there already is a group with the new name.

Parameters:
* $1 - the name the user wanted to rename the group to
centralauth-editgroup-restrictions: Used as label for the wiki set selector or {{msg-mw|centralauth-editgroup-nowikiset}}.
centralauth-editgroup-submit: Used as label for the Submit button in Special:GlobalGroupPermissions.
centralauth-editgroup-success: Subtitle of Special:GlobalGroupPermissions after a group has successfully been altered
centralauth-editgroup-success-text: Text on Special:GlobalGroupPermissions after a group has successfully been altered. $1 is the name of the global group.
centralauth-editset-badwikis:
Used as error message. Parameters:
* $1 - list of bad wikis
* $2 - number of wikis
centralauth-editset-grouplink:
{{optional}}
Used as list item.

The list is preceded by {{msg-mw|Centralauth-editset-usage}}.

Parameters:
* $1 - group name
centralauth-editset-intro-ro:
Used as intro text.

Preceded by {{msg-mw|Centralauth-editset-legend-ro}}.

Followed by a list containing {{msg-mw|Centralauth-editset-item-ro}}.

See also:
* {{msg-mw|Centralauth-editset-intro-rw}}
centralauth-editset-intro-rw:
Used as intro text.

Preceded by {{msg-mw|Centralauth-editset-legend-rw}}.

Followed by a list containing {{msg-mw|Centralauth-editset-item-rw}}.

See also:
* {{msg-mw|Centralauth-editset-intro-ro}}
centralauth-editset-item-rw:
Parameters:
* $1 - Name of wiki set
* $2 - ID of wiki set
See also:
* {{msg-mw|Centralauth-editset-item-ro}} - Optional message
centralauth-editset-nowikis:
Used on Special:WikiSets when there is no wiki in a list
{{Identical|None}}
centralauth-editset-restwikis: All wiki databases *not* defined in this wiki set (either opt-in or opt-out)
centralauth-editset-return:
Used as link text.

Preceded by the success message {{msg-mw|Centralauth-editset-success}}.
centralauth-editset-success:
Used as success message.

Followed by the link text {{msg-mw|Centralauth-editset-return}}.

See also:
* {{msg-mw|Centralauth-editset-success-delete}}
centralauth-editset-usage:
Used as label for usage.

Followed by one of the following messages:
* {{msg-mw|Centralauth-editset-grouplink}} - list item
* {{msg-mw|Centralauth-editset-nouse}} - if there are no usage
centralauth-editset-wikis:
List of wiki databases defined in this wiki set (either opt-in or opt-out).
{{Identical|Wiki}}
centralauth-editset-zerowikis: Used as error message on Special:WikiSets.
centralauth-error-wrongprovider:
Used as an error message. Parameters:
* $1 - Session type in use that makes it not possible to use the special page, from a message like {{msg-mw|sessionprovider-mediawiki-session-cookiesessionprovider}}.
centralauth-finish-send-confirmation:
Ability to send password using email.
{{Identical|E-mail password}}
centralauth-finishglobaliseemail_body:
Body text for account confirmation emails. Parameters:
* $1 - the IP address of the user or server script that triggered the reminder - not needed
* $2 - the name of the user account
* $3 - a URL to [[Special:MergeAccount]], which also confirms email
* $4 - a timestamp (unused)
* $5 - a URL to [[Special:InvalidateEmail]]
* $6 - a date
* $7 - a time
centralauth-finishglobaliseemail_subject: Subject field for account confirmation emails
centralauth-foreign-contributions:
Tooltip in the list of local accounts (on the edit count column) on [{{canonicalurl:m:Special:CentralAuth|target=Siebrand}} Global user manager] special page.

Parameters:
* $1 - the number of contributions
* $2 - the name of the local wiki
centralauth-foreign-link:
Tooltip in list of local accounts on [{{canonicalurl:m:Special:CentralAuth|target=Siebrand}} Global user manager] special page.

Parameters:
* $1 - the username
* $2 - the name of the local wiki
centralauth-globalgroupperms-creategroup:
Used as label for the Submit button.

Preceded by {{msg-mw|Centralauth-globalgroupperms-newgroupname}} and inputbox.
centralauth-globalgroupperms-group:
Message used on column header at the table on Special:GlobalGroupPermissions. See also {{msg-mw|centralauth-globalgroupperms-rights}}
{{Identical|Group}}
centralauth-globalgroupperms-group-disab: Message used on Special:GlobalGroupPermissions table to indicate that the global group is not enabled on the current wiki.
centralauth-globalgroupperms-group-listm: Link label used at Special:GlobalGroupPermissions. Links to Special:GlobalUsers page for the group.
centralauth-globalgroupperms-groups-intr: Introductory message shown at the top of Special:GlobalGroupPermissions.
centralauth-globalgroupperms-management:
Link label used at Special:GlobalGroupPermissions. Links to group specific management page on Special:GlobalGroupPermissions
{{Identical|Management}}
centralauth-globalgroupperms-newgroupnam: I think this needs to be translated as "Name of the new group", not as "New name of the group". – [[User:McDutchie|McDutchie]] 16:40, 20 July 2008 (UTC)
centralauth-globalgroupperms-nogroups: Message shown on Special:GlobalGroupPermissions when there is no existing global groups.
centralauth-globalgroupperms-rights:
Message used on column header at the table on Special:GlobalGroupPermissions. See also {{msg-mw|centralauth-globalgroupperms-group}}.
{{Identical|Right}}
centralauth-globalgroupperms-wikiset-non: Message used on Special:GlobalGroupPermissions table when a group does not belong to any wikiset.
centralauth-hidden-blockreason:
Unused at this time. Parameters:
* $1 - username
* $2 - ...
* $3 - reason
centralauth-list-attached:
Text before the list of local wikis attached to a unified account, shown on the special page "MergeAccount" (Login unification complete!).

Parameters:
* $1 - username
* $2 - number of accounts/names in the list following the message
centralauth-list-attached-dryrun:
Text to inform users of which accounts can be unified after a dry-run. Parameters:
* $1 - username
* $2 - number of accounts/names in the list following the message
centralauth-list-home-dryrun: Message that indication that provided information will be used for authenticating.
centralauth-list-home-title:
Information about user's home wiki.
{{Identical|Home wiki}}
centralauth-list-unattached:
Used in Special:MergeAccount. Parameters:
* $1 - username
* $2 - number of unattached accounts
centralauth-log-gblrename-oldname: Label for field on Special:Log which allows filtering the global rename log by the previous username
centralauth-log-header:
Used as log header in [[Special:Log/globalauth]].

See example: [[w:Special:Log/globalauth]].
centralauth-log-status-hidden: Used as $4 or $5 in {{msg-mw|Logentry-globalauth-setstatus}}. This "hidden" stands for "hidden from public lists". [{{canonicalurl:m:Special:Log|type=globalauth&user=&page=&year=&month=-1&uselang={{SUBPAGENAME}}}} See Wikimedia Metawiki for example]. {{Identical|Hidden}}
centralauth-log-status-oversighted: Used as $4 or $5 in {{msg-mw|Logentry-globalauth-setstatus}}. This "oversighted" stands for "hidden completely". [{{canonicalurl:m:Special:Log|type=globalauth&user=&page=&year=&month=-1&uselang={{SUBPAGENAME}}}} See Wikimedia Metawiki for example] {{Identical|Oversighted}}
centralauth-login-error-locked:
Message displayed while login is not possible because the acting user's account is locked.

Parameters:
* $1 - Username (used for GENDER)
See also:
* {{msg-mw|Centralauth-error-locked}}
centralauth-login-progress:
{{gender}}
Refers to {{msg-mw|Centralauth-groupname}}.

Parameters:
* $1 - (Optional) the username of the logged-in user
* $2 - the number of wikis, used for PLURAL support
See also:
* {{msg-mw|Centralauth-logout-progress}}
centralauth-logout-progress:
{{gender}}
Refers to {{msg-mw|Centralauth-groupname}}.

Parameters:
* $1 - (Optional) the username of the logged-out user
* $2 - the number of wikis, used for PLURAL support
See also:
* {{msg-mw|Centralauth-login-progress}}
centralauth-merge-denied: Error message displayed when trying to visit a web page without having the correct permissions.
centralauth-merge-dryrun-complete: Status message after a dry run to check if user accounts can be unified.
centralauth-merge-dryrun-home: Status message after a dry run to check if user accounts can be unified.
centralauth-merge-dryrun-incomplete: Status message after a dry run to check if user accounts can be unified.
centralauth-merge-dryrun-or:
Message used on a separate line as separator for user alternatives.
{{Identical|Or}}
centralauth-merge-home-password: Status message during the account unification process indicating an incorrect password was entered.
centralauth-merge-method-admin:
Tool tip in list of local accounts on [{{canonicalurl:m:Special:CentralAuth|target=Siebrand}} Global user manager] special page.

Translate this as "an account which has been merged by admin".

See also:
* {{msg-mw|Centralauth-merge-method-admin-desc}}
centralauth-merge-method-questionmark: {{optional}} Shown on Special:CentralAuth in the "Method" column to illustrate that there is a tooltip
centralauth-merge-no-accounts: Used as fatal error message on "no accounts to merge, failed migration".
centralauth-merge-notlogged:
Notice displayed when visiting a page while not logged in.

Followed by the message {{msg-mw|Centralauth-readmore-text}}.

Parameters:
* $1 - a link which points to [[Special:UserLogin]].
centralauth-merge-step1-detail: Directions for form to start account unification.
centralauth-merge-step1-submit: Submit button for 'Confirm more accounts', the second step for creating a global user account.
centralauth-merge-step1-title: Title for a form to start account unification.
centralauth-merge-step2-detail: Directions for form for account unification.
centralauth-merge-step2-submit: Submit button for 'Begin Login Unification', first step for creating a global user account.
centralauth-merge-step2-title: Title for a form for account unification.
centralauth-merge-step3-detail: Directions for form for account unification.
centralauth-merge-step3-submit: Submit button for 'Unify accounts', last step for creating a global user account.
centralauth-merge-step3-title: Title for a form for account unification.
centralauth-newgroup-legend:
Used as fieldset label.

Followed by the intro text:
* {{msg-mw|Centralauth-newgroup-intro}}.
centralauth-not-owner-text:
Unused at this time. Parameters:
* $1 - username
* $2 - ...
centralauth-notice-dryrun: Message displayed while account unification is in demonstration mode.
centralauth-prefs-count-attached:
Used in [[Special:Preferences|{{int:Preferences}}]] special page. Parameters:
* $1 - number of attached sites
See also:
* {{msg-mw|Centralauth-prefs-count-unattached}}
centralauth-prefs-count-unattached:
Used in [[Special:Preferences|{{int:Preferences}}]] special page.

Shown when the migration is incomplete.

Parameters:
* $1 - number of unattached projects
See also:
* {{msg-mw|Centralauth-prefs-count-attached}}
centralauth-prefs-detail-unattached:
This message is displayed as the global account status at [[Special:Preferences|{{int:Preferences}}]] page, when the account is in migration, but the local account is not attached.

Preceded by {{msg-mw|Centralauth-prefs-unattached}}.

See example: [[mw:Special:Preferences]].
centralauth-prefs-manage: Link on '{{int:Prefs-personal}}' tab of '{{int:Preferences}}' special page.
centralauth-prefs-not-managed:
This message is displayed as the global account status at [[Special:Preferences|{{int:Preferences}}]] page, when the account is not merged at all.

Preceded by the label {{msg-mw|Centralauth-prefs-status}}.

See example: [[mw:Special:Preferences]].
{{Related|Centralauth-prefs}}
centralauth-prefs-unattached:
This message is displayed as the global account status at [[Special:Preferences|{{int:Preferences}}]] page, when the account is in migration, but the local account is not attached.

Preceded by the label {{msg-mw|Centralauth-prefs-status}}.

Followed by {{msg-mw|Centralauth-prefs-detail-unattached}}.

See example: [[mw:Special:Preferences]].
{{Related|Centralauth-prefs}}
centralauth-readonly: Error message displayed when the CentralAuth database is locked.
centralauth-readonlytext:
Description of the centralauth-readonly error. Parameters:
* $1 - the configured reason for the read only mode.
centralauth-rename-abortlogin:
Error message shown to the user when they try logging in while their account is being renamed or merged.

Parameters:
* $1 - the user's username
centralauth-rename-alreadyexists: Error message if there is already an account at the new username.
centralauth-rename-alreadyinprogress: Error message if the user is already being renamed. $1 the new username.
centralauth-rename-antispoofconflicts2: Error message shown if the username conflicts in AntiSpoof either because of similarity or the target used to be someone else's username. $1 is a comma-separated list of conflicting usernames. $2 is number of conflicting usernames - for use with PLURAL.
centralauth-rename-badusername: Error message if the new username is not valid.
centralauth-rename-cannotself: Error message if the user tries renaming themselves.
centralauth-rename-confirm: Confirmation text asking whether the global account should really be renamed.
centralauth-rename-conflict-hidden: Text displayed instead of the username if the user has been hidden
centralauth-rename-deny: Confirm text asking whether the global rename request should really be denied.
centralauth-rename-doesnotexist: Error message if the account provided does not exist.
centralauth-rename-form-allowhigheditcou: Label for checkbox asking for confirmation to globally rename a user with more than a certain number of edits. $1 is this edit count threshold.
centralauth-rename-form-movepages: Label for checkbox of whether to move the user's user pages.
centralauth-rename-form-newname: Label for form field of new account name
centralauth-rename-form-oldname: Label for form field of name of account to rename
centralauth-rename-form-overrideantispoo: Label for checkbox on whether to override any AntiSpoof conflicts
centralauth-rename-form-overridetitlebla: Label for checkbox on whether to override TitleBlacklist
centralauth-rename-form-reason:
{{Identical|Reason}}
Label for form field of log reason for the rename
centralauth-rename-form-suppressredirect: Label for checkbox of whether to suppress redirects when moving the user's user pages.
centralauth-rename-globaleditcount-thres: Message shown on Special:GlobalRenameUser if the user has more than a certain number of edits. $1 is the number of edits.
centralauth-rename-listed-on-denylist: Message shown by Special:GlobalRenameUser if the renamed user is listed in the deny list.
centralauth-rename-movelog:
Move log comment used when automatically moving user pages

* $1 is the user's old name
* $2 is the user's new name
centralauth-rename-notinprogress:
Message shown when there is no rename in progress for the provided user
* $1 is the username
centralauth-rename-notinstalled: Error message if the RenameUser extension is not installed.
centralauth-rename-progress-fieldset: Text on fieldset around rename progress table
centralauth-rename-progress-item: Text for item in a list containing the currently active global renames. $1 is the user's old name, $2 is the user's new name.
centralauth-rename-progress-list-header: Text above the list of currently active global renames
centralauth-rename-progress-logs-fieldse: Text on fieldset around log entries
centralauth-rename-progress-username:
{{identical|Username}}
Label for username form field on Special:RenameProgress
centralauth-rename-queued:
Message shown after the rename has started.

* $1 is the user's old name
* $2 is the user's new name
* $3 is a list of the database names where rename jobs have been queued
centralauth-rename-table-domain:
{{Identical|Local wiki}}
Table column header for domain name of wiki
centralauth-rename-table-status:
{{Identical|Status}}
Table column header for status of rename
centralauth-rename-table-status-done:
{{Identical|Done}}
Status displayed if the job has completed successfully
centralauth-rename-table-status-failed:
Status displayed if the job failed
{{Identical|Failed}}
centralauth-rename-table-status-inprogre: Status displayed if the job is still in progress
centralauth-rename-table-status-queued: Status displayed if the job is still queued
centralauth-rename-titleblacklist-match: Message shown on Special:GlobalRenameUser if the new username matches a [[mw:Extension:TitleBlacklist]] entry.
centralauth-rename-unattached-intheway: Error message if there are unattached accounts using the new username.
centralauth-renameuser-global-inprogress:
Error message shown on Special:RenameUser if a local rename is attempted while a global one is in progress.

* $1 is the user being renamed's username
centralauth-rightslog-entry-groupperms:
log message in the [{{canonicalurl:m:Special:Log|type=gblrights}} Global rights log].

Parameters:
* $1 - username
* $2 - list of old rights
* $3 - list of new rights
centralauth-rightslog-header:
Used as log header in [[Special:Log/gblrights]].

See example: [[w:Special:Log/gblrights]].
centralauth-ro:
{{doc-special|CentralAuth}}
Same as {{msg-mw|Centralauth}}, but showing when page displayed with the read only mode.
centralauth-welcomecreation-msg:
{{ignored}}
Empty message, can be used on wiki to show extra html on the special page "CentralLogin" while signup a new account.
globalrenameprogress-legend: Label for fieldset around the form on Special:GlobalRenameProgress
globalrenamequeue-action-address:
Link text.
'''NOTE : "Address" is a verb, used here in the meaning of “[Click here to] address this global rename request”.'''
globalrenamequeue-column-rq-completed-ts: Table header. The date of closing the request.
globalrenamequeue-column-rq-performer: Table header for column that shows names of users that have approved to denied global rename requests. Also known as "performers".
globalrenamequeue-column-rq-requested-ts: Table header. The date of opening the request.
globalrenamequeue-email-body-approved-wi:
Email body for approved request.

* $1 is the old username
* $2 is the new username.
* $3 is the message left by the user who processed the request.
globalrenamequeue-email-body-approved:
Email body for approved request.

* $1 is the old username
* $2 is the new username.
globalrenamequeue-email-body-rejected:
Email body for rejected request.

* $1 is the old username.
* $2 is the new username.
* $3 is the message left by the user who processed the request.
globalrenamequeue-email-subject-approved: Email subject line for approved request.
globalrenamequeue-email-subject-rejected: Email subject line for rejected request.
globalrenamequeue-form-newname:
Label of form field shown on Special:GlobalRenameQueue.
See also {{msg-mw|globalrenamequeue-column-rq-newname}}
globalrenamequeue-form-status-all:
Option in status dropdown on Special:GlobalRenameQueue/closed. See {{msg-mw|globalrenamequeue-form-status}}
{{Identical|All}}
globalrenamequeue-nav-closedqueue: Text on a button that opens up the list of closed requests in the global rename queue.
globalrenamequeue-nav-openqueue: Text on a button that opens up the list of open requests in the global rename queue.
globalrenamequeue-request-antispoof-conf: Informational message shown when a user's requested name is similar to other existing usernames or it used to be username of someone else. $1 is a comma separated list of usernames, $2 is the number of usernames for PLURAL support.
globalrenamequeue-request-header:
Page content when processing request.

* $1 is an URL-link to the user's User page 
* $2 is the user's current name
* $3 is the user's requested name.
globalrenamequeue-request-previous-renam: Text for fieldset label surrounding log entries of the requesting username's previous renames. $1 is the number of log entries for PLURAL.
globalrenamequeue-request-reason:
Display for reason provided by user for rename.

* $1 is reason text given by user. It will be parsed as wikitext.
globalrenamequeue-request-reason-label: Label for field that will be used as the log comment in the public rename log
globalrenamequeue-request-reason-sul: Default reason for SUL rename requests.
globalrenamequeue-request-status-title: Page title when viewing processed request.
globalrenamequeue-request-titleblacklist: Message shown when a user's requested name matches a [[mw:Extension:TitleBlacklist|title blacklist]] entry. $1 is the regular expression which matched the username.
globalrenamequeue-request-unknown-body: Page content when an invalid URL is requested.
globalrenamequeue-request-unknown-title: Page title when an invalud URL is requested.
globalrenamequeue-request-userinfo-globa:
Message expected to be configured per-wiki via MediaWiki:Globalrenamequeue-request-userinfo-global.

* $1 is the requesting user's name.
* $2 is the domain name of the requesting user's home wiki.
* $3 is the requested username.
* $4 is the number of edits by the global account.
globalrenamequeue-request-userinfo-local:
Message expected to be configured per-wiki via MediaWiki:Globalrenamequeue-request-userinfo-local.

* $1 is the requesting user's name.
* $2 is the domain name of the requesting user's home wiki.
* $3 is the requested username.
globalrenamequeue-view:
Display a completed request.

* $1 is the original username.
* $2 is the requested username.
* $3 is the reason for the rename request.
* $4 is the status of the request.
* $5 is the date and time the request was made.
* $6 is the date and time the request was processed.
* $7 is a link to the user page of the steward who processed the request.
* $8 is the username of the steward who processed the request.
* $9 is notes made by the steward.
globalrenamequeue-view-approved:
Display text for an approved request.
{{Identical|Approved}}
globalrenamequeue-view-rejected:
Display text for a rejected request.
{{Identical|Rejected}}
globalrenamerequest-email-mismatch: Error message shown when the user enters two different email addresses
globalrenamerequest-email-why-explain: Information message for email address field shown on Special:GlobalRenameRequest.
globalrenamerequest-forced:
Explanation for users that are being forced to rename.

Followed by the message {{msg-mw|globalrenamerequest-pretext}}
globalrenamerequest-legend: Used as fieldset label. "Unification" refers to the process of unifying all the accounts.
globalrenamerequest-newname-help:
Form field inline help.

* $1 is a randomly generated username suggestion.
globalrenamerequest-self-warning: Shown as a warning in form.
globalrenamerequest-status-text:
Pending request description.

* $1 is the user's current name
* $2 is the user's requested name
globalrenamerequest-status-title: Page title when request is pending.
globalrenameuser-legend: Label for fieldset around the form on Special:GlobalRenameUser
logentry-gblrights-setchange: {{Logentry}} Additional parameters: * $4 - name of wiki set formatted as a link * $5 - wikis which were added, or {{msg-mw|rightsnone}} (if empty) * $6 - wikis which were removed, or {{msg-mw|rightsnone}} (if empty) * $7 - number of wikis which were added (to be used in PLURAL) * $8 - number of wikis which were removed (to be used in PLURAL) You can use {{PLURAL:$7|0=...}} if you need different wording for when no wikis were added/removed.
logentry-gblrights-setrename:
{{Logentry}}
Additional parameters:
* $4 - new name of wiki set formatted as a link
* $5 - old name of wiki set
logentry-gblrights-grouprename:
{{logentry}}
Additional parameters:
* $4 - the title of the new group
* $5 - the title of the old group
logentry-gblrights-groupprms2:
{{logentry}}
Additional parameters:
* $4 - list of rights which were added
* $5 - list of rights which were removed
logentry-gblrights-groupprms3:
{{logentry}}
Additional parameters:
* $4 - the name of the previous wiki set
* $5 - the name of the new wiki set
logentry-gblrights-usergroups:
{{logentry}}
Additional parameters:
* $4 - list of old groups
* $5 - list of new groups
logentry-newusers-forcecreatelocal:
Log entry message when an administrator manually created a local account for a global user.

{{Logentry}}
right-centralauth-unmerge:
{{doc-right|centralauth-unmerge}}
This is the opposite of merging a local (unlinked) account to a global account. It doesn't imply the complete disgregation of the global account, as even a single local account can be unmerged.
sessionprovider-centralauthsessionprovid: Description of the sessions provided by the CentralAuthSessionProvider class, which use HTTP cookies. Should be phrased to make sense when added to a message such as {{msg-mw|cannotloginnow-text}}.
sessionprovider-centralauthtokensessionp: Description of the sessions provided by the CentralAuthTokenSessionProvider class, which uses the 'centralauthtoken' parameter on API requests. Should be phrased to make sense when added to a message such as {{msg-mw|cannotloginnow-text}}.
sulrenamewarning-authmanager-ok-help: Description of the "ok" field when displaying the rename notification during AuthManager authentication.
sulrenamewarning-renamed:
Notice to user that their account has been renamed.

* $1 is the user's old name
* $2 is the user's new name
sulrenamewarning-title:
[[Special:SulRenameWarning]] title

* $1 is the user's new name for GENDER
sulrenamewarning-usenew:
Instructions to user to login with new name in the future

* $1 is the user's new name
centralauth-badaccess-blacklisted: Message shown to users who can't request to be renamed because they are listed on a blacklist.
